ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sree Lakshmi Jabbireddy Charitable Trust is a Private Charitable Foundation that works largely with local communities on initiatives linked to their Health and Hygiene.Its diverse and wide ranging interventions includes, among others, Health awareness and education, Mother and child care, Issue based campaigns on prevention of HIV/AIDS, Ocular health, Diabetes and other life style related disorders, School Health and public health campaigns etc,.It began itâ€™s work during the year 2004 and itâ€™s health outreach interventions have currently spread over to 22 districts and reached around 2,27,000 rural poor forming part of Andhra Pradesh. Health Awareness and Education Community Based Care and health outreach Free Health Resource Centres ie, One at Obulavaripalle in Cuddapah district and the other at Padmaraonagar in Secunderabad. Community Ocular Health Reproductive and Child Care Diabetes Care Child Health and Immunization Training of community Health workers Essential medicines acees programme 2 Nos of Health Resource Centres one at Obulavaripalli in kadapa district and the other at Padmaraonagar in Secunderabad which have so far provided the following services to around 30000 poor and migrant communities. Family Planning and Contraception Curative services Management of STD Diabetes care and management Ocular health Child health and immunization Training Programs to Paramedics Awareness and prevention education on HIV/AIDS B) Community outreach programs: Organized 46 Mega Health Camps in around 22 districts of Andhra Pradesh benefiting around 2, 27,000 Rural poor. Organized 32 School Health Programs in various schools and the children were screened for ocular deficiencies, deworming and dental flossing. The trust has organized 15 Marital counseling Camps, to educate the newly wed couples on contraceptive choices, birth spacing and personal hygiene. The Trust has trained 5 community Health Facilitators and deployed them at various Gram Panchayats to train the PRI Staff in community health

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sri Dakshinya Bhava Samithi a voluntary organization which sprang from the abysmal agony exerienced by Dr T V Rao on having two mentally retarded children made an informal and humble beginning in its inception in 1995 with a meager strength of 7 children and 2 teachers has grown Exponentially and has completed Fourteen Serviceful years to mentally handicapped children of this state Activities are conducting such as 1 Creating awareness for prevention identification and assessment of PWD 2 Early Intervention 3 Special Education 4 Therapeutic Services Speech Yoga Physio Dance etc 5 Integrated Education 6 Vocational Training 7 Sheltered Work Shop 8 Employment 9 Community Based Rehabilitation 10 Training Programmes for Parents Anganwadi Workers Normal Teachers Grand Parents Sibblings Achievements are 1 Mainstreamed 18 children into normal school 2 V Lakshmi Sailaja from Guntur completed her Bacholors Degree through Distance Education 3 Best Parental Award by National Trust New Delhi 4 Service Award by Godfrey Philips India Foundation New Delhi 2007 5 Smt Jamuna Devi Tribrewala Award by FAP CCI, Hyderabad 2004 6 Premlata peshawaria National Award 2009 7 Service Award by Siva Foundation Chennai 2004 8 National Status Award for Social Development by Health and Education Intelectual Development New Delhi 2008 9 Best Service Award by ICFAI Deemed University 2005 10 Visista Seva Ratna Award by AARADHANA Hyderabad 2004

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: St.Mary Educational Society is a non-profit organization started in 1994 (Regd No. 3059/94 Govt. of AP) with avision to support needy helpless children in rural areas of AP, India . We need every support we can get to be able to reach out all the children who are helpless. Most of St. Mary children are orphans, semi-orphans, handicaps and mentalretard children belonging to tribal and economical backward community of ruralareas of Andhra Pradesh, India. St.Mary Educational Society focuses on helpless children in India. Our purpose is to educate these children that become uneducated due to economic constrains or natural disasters. Our non-profit organization is committed to bring the HOPE and smiles on the faces in the life of a needy child. Through your support a child will have the opportunity to get education, health care and nutritious food.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: I am proud that the birth of SYA took place at the hearts of self-less dedicated young founder members. We started our youth-to-community work with an intention to do some thing to needy community around us. We did not contemplate a village-based youth group will become as Voluntary Organisation. Since its inception up to 1991 our focus was only on community-based youth related activities with active collaboration of Nehru Yuva Kendra. We are grateful to Mr. Mohd. Khallelulaah (Youth Co- ordinators) for providing initial guidance. SYA journey of development interventions started in the month of November 1991 with SIDA support by adopting 10 projects villages. We are indebted to Late Mr. Sampath Kumar, who is at that time staff member of MYRADA for his consultancy at free cost and demonstrate the way to access external funds. Since then, we have received active funding support from both Governmental and Foreign Aid to implement various development interventions. As founder member of Network of Voluntary Organisation in Kurnool District (NOVOK), SYA builts linkages with District Administration, United Nations Development Programmes (UNDP) and Action Aid. As active member of NOVOK, SYA promoted SHG movement by formation and strengthening of SHGs and village and mandal level networks. I am indebted to Sri Premchandra Reddy, I.A.S., who has trust on SYA initial stage and also provided guidance and steadfast support as UNDP and Action Aid Partner NGO. In SYAâ€™s cruise to address issues environmental and natural resource management in promoting and strengthening CFM movement in the adjacent Nallamalla forests area, â€œAndhra Pradesh Farmers Managed Ground Water Systemsâ€ to enable rural farmers to manage their own ground water systems in and around Gooty of Ananatapur District.
